label: Airports
description: Airports compares the total number of airports or airfields recognizable from the air. The runway(s) may be paved or unpaved and may include closed or abandoned installations.

label: Birth rate (factbook)
description: Birth rate compares the average annual number of births during a year per 1,000 persons in the population at midyear; also known as crude birth rate.

label: Budget expenditures
description: Revenues, expenditures, and capital expenditures. These figures are calculated on an exchange rate basis, i.e., not in purchasing power parity (PPP) terms.

label: Budget revenues
description: The difference between national government revenues and expenditures, expressed as a percent of GDP. A positive (+) number indicates that revenues exceeded expenditures (a budget surplus), while a negative (-) number indicates the reverse (a budget deficit). Normalizing the data, by dividing the budget balance by GDP, enables easy comparisons across countries and indicates whether a national government saves or borrows money. Countries with high budget deficits (relative to their GDPs) generally have more difficulty raising funds to finance expenditures, than those with lower deficits.

label: Coastline
description: The total length of the boundary between the land area (including islands) and the sea.

label: Death rate
description: Death rate compares the average annual number of deaths during a year per 1,000 population at midyear; also known as crude death rate.

label: Electricity consumption
description: Electricity - consumption compares total electricity generated annually plus imports and minus exports, expressed in kilowatt-hours.

label: Electricity exports
description: Electricity â exports is the total exported electricity in kilowatt-hours.

label: Electricity imports
description: Electricity - imports is the total imported electricity in kilowatt-hours.

label: Electricity production
description: Electricity - production compares the annual electricity generated expressed in kilowatt-hours.

label: Electricity production from fossil fuel
description: Electricity â from fossil fuels measures the capacity of plants that generate electricity by burning fossil fuels (such as coal, petroleum products, and natural gas), expressed as a share of the country's total generating capacity.

label: Electricity production from hydroelectric plants
description: Electricity - from hydroelectric plants measures the capacity of plants that generate electricity by water-driven turbines, expressed as a share of the country's total generating capacity.

label: Electricity production from nuclear
description: Electricity - from nuclear fuels measures the capacity of plants that generate electricity through radioactive decay of nuclear fuel, expressed as a share of the country's total generating capacity.

label: Electricity production from other renewable sources
description: Electricity - from other renewable sources measures the capacity of plants that generate electricity by using renewable energy sources other than hydroelectric (including, for example, wind, waves, solar, and geothermal), expressed as a share of the country's total generating capacity.

label: Exports
description: Exports compares the total US dollar amount of merchandise exports on an f.o.b. (free on board) basis. These figures are calculated on an exchange rate basis.

label: External debt
description: External debt compares the total public and private debt owed to nonresidents repayable in foreign currency, goods, or services. These figures are calculated on an exchange rate basis.

label: Forest and woodland
description: Forest area is land spanning more than 0.5 hectare with trees higher than five meters and a canopy cover of more than 10% to include windbreaks, shelterbelts, and corridors of trees greater than 0.5 hectare and at least 20 m wide.

label: Government type
description: The basic form of government.

label: GDP (factbook)
description: The gross domestic product (GDP) or value of all final goods and services produced within a nation in a given year.

label: GDP per capita (factbook)
description: GDP - per capita (PPP) compares GDP on a purchasing power parity basis divided by population as of 1 July for the same year.

label: GDP real gowth (factbook)
description: GDP - real growth rate compares GDP growth on an annual basis adjusted for inflation and expressed as a percent.

label: Roadways
description: The total length of the road network and includes the length of the paved and unpaved portions.

label: Imports
description: Imports compares the total US dollar amount of merchandise imports on a c.i.f. (cost, insurance, and freight) or f.o.b. (free on board) basis. These figures are calculated on an exchange rate basis.

label: Industrial production growth rate
description: Industrial production growth rate compares the annual percentage increase in industrial production (includes manufacturing, mining, and construction).

label: Infant mortality rate
description: Infant mortality rate compares the number of deaths of infants under one year old in a given year per 1,000 live births in the same year. This rate is often used as an indicator of the level of health in a country.

label: Military age
description: Required ages for voluntary or conscript military service and the length of service obligation.

label: Permanent crops
description: Land cultivated for crops like citrus, coffee, and rubber that are not replanted after each harvest, and includes land under flowering shrubs, fruit trees, nut trees, and vines.

label: Permanent pastures and meadows
description: Land used for at least five years or more to grow herbaceous forage, either cultivated or growing naturally.

label: Water area
description: Water area is the sum of the surfaces of all inland water bodies, such as lakes, reservoirs, or rivers, as delimited by international boundaries and/or coastlines.

label: Human Development Index
description: âThe Human Development Index (HDI) is a summary measure of average achievement in key dimensions of human development: a long and healthy life, being knowledgeable and have a decent standard of living. The HDI is the geometric mean of normalized indices for each of the three dimensions.â (http://hdr.undp.org/en/content/human-development-index-hdi).

label: Population size
description: Number of people inhabiting the place; number of people of subject.

label: Unemployment rate
description: Portion of a workforce population that is not employed.

label: Basic form of government
description: Subjects type of government (e.g., republic, monarch, representative democracy).

label: Surface area
description: Area occupied by an object.

label: Life expectancy
description: Average life expectancy for this group.

label: Number of out-of-school children
description: Number of out-of-school children reported for a place.

label: Age of majority
description: Threshold of adulthood as recognized or declared in law.

label: Marriageable age
description: Minimum age at which a person is generally allowed by law to marry.

label: Compulsory education (minimum age)
description: Minimum age for children when compulsory education starts.

label: Compulsory education (maximum age)
description: Maximum age for children when compulsory education ends.

label: Total fertility rate
description: Average number of children that would be born to a woman over her lifetime.

label: Railway traffic side
description: Indicates for a country or a railway line whether rail traffic usually runs on the left or right hand side.

label: Literacy rate
description: Percentage of the population that is not illiterate.

label: Minimum temperature record
description: Lowest temperature reached at this location.

label: Eastern Church exposure
description: Calculated as the number of centuries each country was under the sway of the Eastern Church prior to 1500 CE (adjusted for population movements that have occurred after the year 1500, z-scored).

label: Western Church exposure
description: Calculated as the number of centuries each country was under the sway of the Western Church prior to 1500 CE (adjusted for population movements that have occurred after the year 1500, z-scored).

label: GDP per capita (Current US dollars)
description: Gross Domestic Product per capita (Current US dollars, z-scored).

label: GINI index (World Bank Estimate)
description: GINI index (World Bank Estimate, z-scored).

label: GNI per capita (Constant 2010 US dollars)
description: Gross National Income per capita (Constant 2010 US dollars, z-scored).

label: Kinship intensity index
description: Composite index of Composite index of: Preferences for cousin marriage, Polygamy, Co-residence of extended families, Community organization, Presence of unilineal descent (z-scored).

label: Belief in heaven
description: Do you believe in heaven? (z-scored, reverse-coded so that high scores are interpretable as more beliefs in heaven).

label: Belief in hell
description: Do you believe in hell? (z-scored, reverse-coded so that high scores are interpretable as more beliefs in hell).

label: Belief in life after death
description: Do you believe in life after death? (z-scored, reverse-coded so that high scores are interpretable as more beliefs in life after death).

label: Belief in soul
description: Do you believe people have a soul? (z-scored, reverse-coded so that high scores are interpretable as more beliefs in soul).

label: Confidence in the Armed Forces
description: How much confidence you have in the Armed Forces? (z-scored, reverse-coded so that high scores are interpretable as high confidence in the Armed Forces).

label: Confidence in Government
description: How much confidence you have in the Government? (z-scored, reverse-coded so that high scores are interpretable as high confidence in the Government).

label: Importance of God

description: How important is religion in your life? (z-scored, reverse-coded so that high scores are interpretable as high importance of religion).

label: Years of life lost to communicable disease
description: Years of life lost to communicable disease from WHO (z-scored).

label: Confidence in the Legal System
description: How much confidence you have in the Legal System (z-scored, combined scores from World Values Survey and European Social Survey).

label: Confidence in Parliament
description: How much confidence you have in the Parliament (z-scored, combined scores from World Values Survey and European Social Survey).

label: Confidence in the Police
description: How much confidence you have in the Police (z-scored, combined scores from World Values Survey and European Social Survey).

label: Happiness
description: Combination of the following items: (1) Taking all things together, would you say you are happy?, (2) Taking all things together, how happy would you say you are? (combined scores from World Values Survey and European Social Survey, z-scored, and reverse-coded so that high scores are interpretable as high happiness).

label: Homosexuality justifiable
description: Combination of the following items: (1) Can homosexuality always be justified, never be justified, or something in between, (2) Gay men and lesbians should be free to live their own life as they wish (combined scores from World Values Survey and European Social Survey, z-scored).

label: Signing a petition
description: Combination of the following items: (1) I'd like you to tell me whether you have actually done any of these things, whether you might do it or would never do: signing a petition, (2) During the last 12 months, have you signed a petition? (combined scores from World Values Survey and European Social Survey, z-scored, and reverse-coded so that high scores are interpretable as having signed a petition).

label: Religious attendance
description: How often do you attend religious services? (combined scores from World Values Survey and European Social Survey, z-scored, and reverse-coded so that high scores are interpretable as high religious attendance).

label: Religious voluntary work
description: Doing unpaid work for a religious or church organization (combined scores from World Values Survey and European Social Survey).

label: Control of corruption (World Bank Estimate)
description: Control of corruption (World Bank Estimate, z-scored).

label: Demanding geoclimate
description: Country or regionâs midrange temperature controlled for the winter-summer variation in summer (z-scored).

label: Food deprivation

label: Government effectiveness
description: Perceptions of the quality of public services, the quality of the civil service and the degree of its independence from political pressures, the quality of policy formulation and implementation, and the credibility of the government's commitment to such policies (z-scored).

label: Historical GDP per capita
description: GDP per capita (1990 International GearyKhamis dollars) for the year 1950.

label: Historical prevalence of pathogens
description: Prevalence of leishmanias, schistosomes, trypanosomes, leprosy, malaria, typhus, filariae, dengue, and tuberculosis.

label: Individualism
description: Individualism is the extent to which people feel independent, as opposed to being interdependent as members of larger wholes (z-scored).

label: Cousin marriage index
description: Historical prevalence of cousin marriage (z-scored).

label: Market competitveness
description: Global competitiveness index (z-scored).

label: Democracy index
description: Composite index of: Pluralism, Functioning of government, Political participation, Political culture, Civil liberty (z-scored).

description: Amount of permanent pasture land relative to country area from FAOSTAT (z-scored).

label: Residential mobility
description: Five-year Aggregate Crude Migration Intensity index (ACMI), based on information on all changes of address (z-scored).

label: Subsistence style - rice agriculture
description: Amount of irrigated harvested rice relative to country's amount of cereal land from FAO/IIASA (z-scored).

description: Perceptions of the extent to which people have confidence in and abide by the rules of society (z-scored).

label: Size of shadow economy (World Bank Estimate)
description: Size of shadow economy (World Bank Estimate, z-scored).

label: Trust (Global Preference Survey)
description: I assume that people have only the best intentions (z-scored).

label: Vulnerability to natural disasters
description: Composite index of the following items: (1) frequency of natural disasters, (2) severity, (3) number of deaths caused by natural disasters from Environmental Susteinability Index (z-scored and reverse-coded so that high scores are interpretable as high vulnerability to disasters).

label: Subsistence style - wheat
description: Amount of irrigated harvested wheat relative to country's amount of cereal land from FAO/IIASA (z-scored).

label: Population density in 1500
description: AD1500 real population density (McEvendy and Jones, 1978) log: population per square kilometer of arable land in a country (extracted directly from Thompson osf data) (z-scored).

label: Relational mobility
description: How much freedom and opportunity a society or social context affords individuals to choose and dispose of interpersonal relationships based on personal preference (z-scored).

label: Importance of caring for people
description: It is very important to him to help the people around him. He wants to care for their well-being (z-scored, reverse-coded so that high scores are interpretable as more importance of caring for others).

label: Importance of caring for nature
description: He strongly believes that people should care for nature. Looking after the environment is important to him (z-scored, reverse-coded so that high scores are interpretable as more importance of caring for nature).

label: Importance of listening to different people
description: It is important to him to listen to people who are different from him. Even when he disagrees with them, he still wants to understand them (z-scored, reverse-coded so that high scores are interpretable as more importance of listening to different people).

label: Importance of equal treatment
description: He thinks it is important that every person in the world should be treated equally. He believes everyone should have equal opportunities in life (z-scored, reverse-coded so that high scores are interpretable as more importance of equal treatment).

label: Importance of loyalty
description: It is important to him to be loyal to his friends. He wants to devote himself to people close to him (z-scored, reverse-coded so that high scores are interpretable as more importance of loyalty).

label: Societal cynicism
description: Belief that people exploit others (z-scored, reverse-coded so that high scores are interpretable as high societal cynicism).

label: GDP
description: Market value of all officially recognized final goods and services produced within a country in a given period of time.

label: GDP per capita
description: Country's total GDP divided by the population.

label: Observation
description: An association between a continuous independent variable and an outcome variable, or a contrast between two levels of a categorical independent variable on an outcome variable.

label: All trials
description: All trials

description: The type of cooperative behavior used as a dependent variable.

description: Cooperative behavior when game (e.g., prisoner's dilemma or public goods dilemma) had a maximum of two choice options. Higher numbers equal higher cooperation

description: Whether cooperation was coded as a percentage of endowment. TRUE = percentage, FALSE = mean.

description: The effective sample size used in the computation of the effect size estimate.

Because the within-subject correlation is not available, this parameter is set to 0.5. The variance is computed as var(d) = 1/n + d^2 / (2*n).

description: Other trials

description: First trial

description: Last trial

description: Personality traits are probabilistic descriptions of relatively stable patterns of emotion, motivation, cognition, and behavior, in response to classes of stimuliâ (DeYoung, 2015, p. 35).

description: Dispositional weights individuals assign to their own and to othersâ outcomes in interdependent situations (Kuhlman, Camac, & Cunha, 1986; McClintock, 1972)

description: The questionnaire used to measure the individual differences variable.

description: Main effect
