description: Emotions are discrete, automatic responses to universally shared, culture-specific and individual-specific events (Ekman & Cordaro, 2011).

label: Emotion intensity
description: Magnitude or strength of the experienced or expressed emotion.

label: Emotion valence
description: Emotional valence is one of two axes (or dimensions) on which an emotion can be located. Value associated with a stimulus as expressed on a continuum from pleasant and attractive (positive) to unpleasant and aversive (negative). Emotional valence is coded when the study explicitly referred to it, without referring to a specific emotion. For example, own smiling is coded as positive emotion.

label: Endogenous motivational orientation
description: Participants have adopted a specific goal when interacting in the game (both as result of self report measures and classified as such based on behavior in other tasks). Some studies falling into this category allow participants to select the goal they want to pursue among a set of possible goals.

label: Endowment level
description: Relative level of tokens participants were endowed with in a Public Goods Game. Each study can have its own criterion for grouping the endowments into levels.

label: Entitativity level
description: The relative level of entitativity (i.e., the perception that the group is an entity) between participants.

label: Effect size algorithm
description: The algorithm used to compute the effect size estimate.

label: Effect size measure
description: The metric in which the standardized effect size estimate is expressed.

label: Ethnicity (US)
description: Participant's ethnic group (values adopted from US Census).

label: Expectations level
description: Participant expectations have been manipulated in the study, or authors split the sample in some way based on stated expectations of partner cooperation.

label: Experimental setting
description: The setting in which the experiment was conducted.

label: External MPCR level
description: Relative level of earnings participants gain from a token contributed to the public good, when there is a difference between participant's return from the public good and other group members' return from the public good.

label: Feedback content
description: What type of feedback information participants receive after each trial of the game (Note that earnings feedback might entails other feedback contents, such as feedback about rank).

label: Feedback target
description: What type of information participants received about their partner(s) decisions and/or outcomes after each trial of the game (Note that Individual feedback entails Group feedback).

label: Gain-Loss frame
description: Gain vs. loss framing is a form of valence framing (Levin, Schneider, & Gaeth, 1998; Gerlach, Jaeger, & Hertwig, 2018). Specifically, outcomes of the decision are either in the domain of gains (i.e., positively-valued) or in the domain of losses (i.e., negatively valued).

label: Comprehension of the game level
description: Participants are classified according to their relative level of comprehension of the game.

label: Game incentive
description: Whether participantsâ decisions in the game determine their payoffs in different forms.

label: Game type
description: Game that participants play during the experimental session. Code it when participants' behavior is compared across multiple games.

label: Gender
description: Participant's gender as reported in the paper. Positive correlations effect size always mean that men cooperated more than women.

label: Gender of the partner
description: Partner's gender as reported in the paper. Positive correlations effect size always mean that participants cooperated more with men than with women.

label: Gender role
description: Gender role refers to the culturally and socially constructed meanings that describe how women and men should behave in certain situations according to feminine and masculine roles learned throughout life (Alabas et al., 2012).

label: Give-Take frame
description: Give-some vs. take-some games are a form of valence framing involving changes in the suggested property rights. For instance, common pool games can be described as decisions on how much to âgiveâ to a public good (public goods games) or how much to âtakeâ from a collectively shared resource (commons dilemmas) (Gerlach, Jaeger, & Hertwig, 2018).

label: Gossip
description: People were allowed to share evaluations to others about their partners behavior.

label: Group size level
description: Relative size of the group, in case exact group size is not provided or it is not relevant (e.g., different group sizes are collapsed together and compared with others).

label: Group type
description: Whether the group the participant is interacting with is a naturally occurring group or experimentally induced group (e.g., minimal group paradigm).

label: Group variability
description: Participants are given information about the variability in group member behavior.

label: Hormone
description: Participants were tested for the presence of a specific hormone.

label: Hormone level
description: Participants were classified according to their level of a specific hormone.

label: Hormones administration
description: Participants were administered hormones prior to the decision in the game (e.g., via intranasal administration).

label: Identification level
description: Extent to which the participants identify with their partner(s).

label: Income tax rate level
description: The relative level of the proportion of net income taken under the tax.

label: Individual difference
description: Personality traits are probabilistic descriptions of relatively stable patterns of emotion, motivation, cognition, and behavior, in response to classes of stimuliâ (DeYoung, 2015, p. 35).

label: Individual difference level
description: Agents were classified according to a specific individual difference measure that could be measured (e.g., via a questionnaire) or manipulated (elicited experimentally). Each study might have its own grouping criterion (e.g., via a median split).

label: Individual MPCR level
description: Relative level of earnings participants gain from a token contributed to the public good, when there exist differences between participant's return from the public good and other group members' return from the public good.

label: Institutional choice
description: Whether participants can choose an institution (such as punishment, reward).

label: Intergroup competition
description: A setting whereby multiple groups each experience a social dilemma, incentive structures can promote that groups compete for better outcomes (e.g., the group with better outcomes receives higher earnings), and/or group outcomes of the dilemmas are compared to each other (which can facilitate intergroup competition).

label: Iterated pre-programmed cooperation rate level
description: Relative level of the pre-programmed cooperation rate of a partner.

label: Iterated strategy
description: The specific strategy played by the participant's partner in an iterated game.

label: Knowledge of group membership
description: Who has knowledge of the focal and target agents' group membership.

label: Knowledge of partner's prior behavior
description: Participants were provided information about how their partner behaved previously in the current game or had behaved with others in a previous game (another closely related coding is feedback).

label: Leader's behavior
description: Leaders has behaved in a specific way in the game.

label: Leader's characteristic
description: Leader has a specific quality or style that is measured or manipulated in the study.

label: Leadership assignment rule
description: People use a specific rule to select leaders.

label: Endogenous leadership
description: Participants are able to select the leader versus the leader is assigned by the experimenter or some other external mechanism.

label: Leadership role
description: Participant is assigned to being the Leader or the Follower.

label: Level of analysis
description: The level at which the data were analyzed (e.g., individual or group-based analyses).

label: Lowest choice option level
description: Relative level of the lowest choice option allowed to participants.

label: Type of effect
description: Whether the reported results were main effects of specific variables or interactions between two or more variables.

label: Manipulated versus measured Independent Variable
description: Whether the independent variable was experimentally manipulated or measured.

label: Matching
description: How participants are paired with others during interactions.

label: Minimum contribution
description: Mandatory minimum contributions or taxation set that minimum contribution players must make. Taxation is institutional, i.e., the threshold is set by an institution (this is different from pledges of contributions, which are coded as âCommunicationâ).

label: Minimum contribution level
description: The relative level of the minimum contribution to the public good as a proportion of the endowment.

label: Monitoring cost
description: The cost of accessing information about other players' contributions

label: Motivational orientation
description: Participants were instructed to adopt a specific goal when interacting in the game.

label: MPCR level
description: Relative level of the ratio of benefits to costs for a member to contribute one monetary unit to the group account.

label: MRS level
description: Relative level of the tradeoff between contribution and return from the public good, in order to keep the subjective utility constant.

label: Number of blocks level
description: Relative level of the total number of blocks across the full experimental session.

label: Number of choices level
description: Relative level of the number of choice options players have when making the contribution.

label: Number of trials level
description: Relative level of the number of trials (rounds) in each block.

label: One-shot strategy
description: The specific choice made by the participant's partner in a sequential one-shot game.

label: One-shot vs repeated
description: Whether participants played the game with the same person only once (this also applies if participants switch partners after each trial) versus played the game repeatedly with the same person.

label: Other coding
description: Broad classification of specific variables and treatments can not be captured by any of the variables annotated in the ontology.

label: Partner's behavior level
description: Whether other players are classified or grouped according to their cooperative behavior (cooperative/high contributions vs competitive/low contributions) in early stage of the games or in other games.

label: Participant's behavior level
description: Whether participants or groups are classified or grouped according to their cooperative behavior (cooperative/high contributions vs competitive/low contributions) in early stage of the games or in other games.

label: Partner choice
description: Matching of participants based on either the players' or the experimenter's decision.

label: Partner's emotion
description: Emotion of the participant's partner in the social interaction (as it is reported in the paper). Emotions are discrete, automatic responses to universally shared, culture-specific and individual-specific events (Ekman & Cordaro, 2011).

label: Partner's emotion display
description: Mode by which a participant's partner can convey a certain emotional state.

label: Partner's emotion valence
description: Emotional valence is one of two axes (or dimensions) on which an emotion can be located. Value associated with a stimulus as expressed on a continuum from pleasant and attractive (positive) to unpleasant and aversive (negative). Emotional valence is coded when the study explicitly referred to the valence of the emotion displayed by the partner, without referring to the specific emotion.

label: Partner perception
description: How participants perceive partner(s) in the game according to several characteristics (usually, self-reported).

label: Partner perception level
description: To what extent the partner is perceived in reference to the quality indicated in Partner Perception.

label: Real partner
description: Whether participants interact with real or imagined participants in the game.

label: Partner selection
description: Participants can be chosen for interactions based on past behavior.

label: Partner type
description: The type of partner that interacts with the participant in the game.

label: Physical proximity
description: Participants were placed at difference physical distances during the game.

label: Power level
description: The level of relative social power held by the participant. Power is defined as the asymmetric control over oneâs own or otherâs resources.

label: Power manipulation method
description: The basis of power differences in the game.

label: Power type
description: Specific type of power that was manipulated within a study.

label: Preference for conditional cooperation
description: Participants are classified as having a specific dispositional strategy of cooperation using a strategy method (see Fischbacher et al. 2001).

label: Primed construct
description: Participants were primed with a specific construct.

label: Private account return level
description: Relative level of the private gain for each token contributed to the Private Account.

label: Psychopathology
description: Participants were classified as having abnormal cognitions and behaviors.

label: Published
description: Whether a study was published or not.

label: Public Good-Bad frame
description: Public goods vs. public bads refer to the framing of the consequence of decisions for others. In public goods provision, contributions to the public good are described to provide a benefit to others. In public bad-type games, contributions to the public bad impose a cost on others, or contributions to the private good impose a negative externality on others.

label: Punishment agent
description: Who can enact punishment on other participants (See Agent type).

label: Punishment distribution rule
description: A rule according to which the amount deducted from the account of the punished participant is redistributed or destroyed.

label: Punishment incentive
description: The form in which participants' punishment decisions affect their partner's payoffs (see game incentive).

label: Punishment rule
description: A rule according to which some number of players are punished.

label: Sequential punishment
description: Whether group members make their punishment decisions simultaneously or sequentially, i.e., whether players take decisions one after another while receiving some form of feedback on preceding decisions (see Sequentiality).

label: Punishment treatment
description: Punishment is the (possible) imposition of negative payoffs on a specific participant after the regular round of play.

label: Rebate vs refund
description: Participants are given back (some of) their contributions to the public good, if the public good is not provided (or their partner chooses not to cooperate).

label: Recruitment method
description: The way participants were recruited to take part in the study.

label: Relationship with the partner
description: The type of relationship between the participant and their partner.

label: Religiosity operationalization
description: How is the specific construct pertaining to the religious sphere operationalized in the study.

label: Religious exposure level
description: Whether participants were exposed to a high versus low level of religious content (e.g., enrolled to a religious vs non-religious school).

label: Replenishment rate level
description: Relative level of the replenishment rate in the resource dilemma.

label: Resource size level
description: Relative size of the resource that participants can withdraw in a resource dilemma game.

label: Restart
description: Observed cooperation in the last round of a block of trials compared to the first trial of the subsequent block.

label: Reward agent
description: Who can enact reward on other participants (See Agent type).

label: Reward incentive
description: The form in which participants' reward decisions affect their partner's payoffs (see game incentive).

label: Sequential reward
description: Whether group members make their reward decisions simultaneously or sequentially, i.e., whether players take decisions one after another while receiving some form of feedback on preceding decisions (see Sequentiality).

label: Reward treatment
description: Reward is the imposition of positive payoffs on a specific player after a trial of the game.

label: Values (Schwartz)
description: Human values according to Schwartz classification.

label: Sequentiality
description: Whether group members make their decisions simultaneously or sequentially, i.e., whether participants take decisions one after another while receiving some form of feedback about preceding decisions.

label: Similarity level
description: The level of similarity between the participant and their partner on a relevant dimension (usually self-reported).

label: Social capital level
description: Participants' were classified according to their social capital.

label: State trust level
description: Participants' were classified according to their state trust.

label: Test statistic
description: From STATO: A statistic is a measurement datum to describe a dataset or a variable. It is generated by a calculation on set of observed data.

label: Step return level
description: Relative level of return for reaching the threshold in step-level Public Goods Game.

label: Academic discipline
description: Participant's field of study if the participant is a student.

label: Acquaintance
description: Whether participants were interacting (and were aware of it) with people that they are not acquainted with or with people that they knew outside of the laboratory (e.g., friends, relatives, parents, romantic partners).

label: Continuous vs step-level public goods
description: Whether there was a provision point for contributions to establish a public good (i.e., step-level public goods) versus each contribution provided an incremental benefit to the public good (i.e., continuous public good).

label: Game type
description: Economic game that participants play during the experimental session.

label: Experimental setting
description: The setting in which the experiment was conducted.

label: Game incentive
description: Whether participantsâ decisions in the game determine their payoffs in different forms.

label: Matching
description: How participants are paired with others during interactions.

label: One-shot vs repeated
description: Whether participants played the game with the same person only once (this also applies if participants switch partners after each trial) versus played the game repeatedly with the same person.

label: Real partner
description: Whether participants interact with real or imagined participants in the game.

label: Sequentiality
description: Whether group members make their decisions simultaneously or sequentially, i.e., whether participants take decisions one after another while receiving some form of feedback about preceding decisions.

label: Show-up fee
description: Whether participants received a show-up fee for the study (i.e., a certain payment for participation).

label: Trial of cooperation
description: Trial on which cooperation was assessed.

label: SVO type
description: Participants were classified according to the specific type of social value orientation that resulted in the SVO measure.

label: Symmetry target
description: How specific aspects of the game that were different (i.e., asymmetric) for participants.

label: Partner's group membership
description: Whether the participant is interacting with a partner identified as ingroup, outgroup, or stranger.

label: Threshold level
description: Relative level of the minimum threshold of total contribution by all group members when the public good will be provided. This also defines the criticality of contributions, as contributions are more critical if other players cannot reach the threshold on their own (esp. in sequential games where othersâ prior contributions are known).

label: Time pressure
description: Whether participants were instructed to make their decisions in a limited amount of time or with a longer amount of time.

label: Trial of cooperation (ordinal)
description: Trial on which cooperation is assessed on an ordinal scale.

label: Institution type
description: The type of institution that can be established.

label: Uncertainty level
description: The relative level of uncertainty of the treatment.

label: Uncertainty target
description: Whether participants receive uncertain information about a certain aspect of the game. This also includes receiving detailed vs less specific information, as well as events happening certainly versus events happening with a probability.

label: Highest choice option level
description: Relative level of the highest choice option allowed to participants.

label: Vote outcome
description: Whether the vote resulted in the targeted outcome or did not result in the targeted outcome.

label: Vote target
description: Whether the vote is to establish a new institution or to remove an existing institution.

label: Source of year of data collection
description: Source of information about what year the data was collected.

label: Independent Variable
description: A variable that is measured or manipulated and than related to a dependent variable, such as cooperation.

label: IndependentVariable
description: A variable that is measured or manipulated and than related to a dependent variable, such as cooperation.

label: Independent Variable
description: Variable manipulated by an experimenter.

label: IndependentVariable
description: Variable manipulated by an experimenter.

label: Anchor-related independent variables
description: Variables related to whether participants were provided with some anchors (e.g., a suggested level of contribution) while making their decisions

label: Reputation-related independent variables
description: Variables related to whether participants' have available reputational cues about how other behaved in the game, and vice-versa, such as knowledge of partner's behavior and anonymity

label: Game Type-related independent variables
description: Variables related to the type of game played by the participants, including the correlation of observed behavior in different games

label: Institutional Choice-related independent variables
description: Variables related to how institutions (e.g., punishment and reward mechanisms) were established, such as institutional choice or vote strategy

label: Degree of conflicting interests-related independent variables
description: Variables related to the degree of conflict in the prisoner's dilemma

label: Framing-related independent variables
description: Variables related to the way information is presented about the same underlying game, such as gain-loss fraiming and give-take framing

label: Time Pressure-related independent variables
description: Variables related to the time participants spent to make the decision, such as whether they had time pressure

label: Normative Behavior-related independent variables
description: Variables related to whether participants are provided information about normative behaviors in thier group while making their decisions

label: Emotions-related independent variables
description: Variables related to participants' and partner's emotional states as assessed or manipulated in the game

label: Motivational Orientation-related independent variables
description: Variables related to the goals participants adopted to guide their decisions in the game

label: Identification-related independent variables
description: Variables related to whether the participants identified their partner(s) as a member of the ingroup, outgroup, or unidentified stranger, including variables such as partner group membership and common knowledge of partner group membership

label: Ethnicity-related independent variables
description: Variables related to participants' ethnicity

label: Experimental Setting-related independent variables
description: Variables related to the setting in which the experiment was conducted, such as lab, classroom, or online.

label: Extra annotation-related independent variables
description: Variables that could not be classified in any existing superclass

label: Feedback-related independent variables
description: Variables related to the information participants received about partners' behavior in the game

label: Incentives-related independent variables
description: Variables related to how decisions in the game determine the payoff, such as presence of a lottery or provision of a show-up fee

label: Gender-related independent variables
description: Variables related to participants' gender

label: Perception of the partner(s)-related independent variables
description: Variables related to how participants perceive the partner(s) in the game

label: Gender Role-related independent variables
description: Variables related to participants' gender roles

label: Hormones-related independent variables
description: Variables related to participants' (assessed or administered) hormonal levels while making their decisions

label: Personality-related independent variables
description: Variables related to participants' personality traits or individual differences in abnormal cognitions and behaviors

label: Institution  -related independent variables
description: Variables related to other institutional mechanisms than punishment and reward, such as the implementation of rebates and refunds

label: Intergroup Competition -related independent variables
description: Variables related to settings in which multiple groups each experience a social dilemma, incentive structures promote that groups compete for better outcomes, and/or group outcomes of the dilemmas are compared to each other.

label: Partner(s)' strategies-related independent variables
description: Variables related to the strategies played by participants' partner in the game

label: Matching-related independent variables
description: Variables related to how participants are paired with others during the interaction, such as matching protocol and partner choice

label: Partner real-related independent variables
description: Variables related to whether participants interacted with a real or imaginary partner

label: Partner type-related independent variables
description: Variables related to the type of partner that interacts with the participant in the game

label: Physical Proximity-related independent variables
description: Variables related to the extent to which participants were phisically close while making their decision

label: Power-related independent variables
description: Variables related to the relative power held by the participant in the game, such as the level of power, type of power, and method used to establish power asymmetries

label: Preferences for Conditional Cooperation-related independent variables
description: Variables related to participants' classification according to stable preference for certain strategies of cooperation

label: Priming-related independent variables
description: Variables related to any primes participants received prior to making the decision

label: Punishment-related independent variables
description: Variables related to the implementation of the imposition of negative payoffs as a result of the behavior in the game, such as punishment probability and punishment effectiveness

label: Re-Start Effect-related independent variables
description: Variables related to the difference between cooperation observed as first or last round of a block

label: Reward-related independent variables
description: Variables related to the implementation of the imposition of positive payoffs as a result of the behavior in the game, such as reward probability and reward effectiveness

label: Values-related independent variables
description: Variables related to participants' values

label: Sequentiality-related independent variables
description: Variables related to turn taking and sequential decision making in the game

label: Symmetry-related independent variables
description: Variables related to whether specific aspects of the game were equal or different for all the players involved

label: Uncertainty-related independent variables
description: Variables related to whether participants received certain or uncertain information about specific aspects of the game

label: Published vs unpublished
description: Whether the treatment or effect size quantitative information was published. TRUE = The treatment or effect size came from published information, FALSE = The treatment or effect size was calculated from raw data or requested to authors.

label: Focal participant has rewarded
description: Whether the focal participant rewarded another player in the previous trial of the game. TRUE = Focal participant rewarded another player in the previous trial, FALSE = Focal participant did not reward another player in the previous trial.

label: Group size multilevel ratio
description: Games can be multilevel in which contribution decisions do not involve a single group, but two or more groups of different sizes and participants can make decisions to contribute to local and global accounts (e.g., Buchan et al., 2011). It is calculated as number of participants in the smallest unit divided by number of total participants in the broader collective.

label: Number of sessions
description: The number of full experimental sessions. Each session involves multiple blocks (i.e., iterated games of varying, but predetermined length).

label: Other coding
description: Broad classification of specific variables and treatments can not be captured by any of the variables annotated in the ontology.

label: Total reserves
description: Total reserves comprise holdings of monetary gold, special drawing rights, reserves of IMF members held by the IMF, and holdings of foreign exchange under the control of monetary authorities.

label: GDP (PPP) per capita
description: GDP divided by the population total and adjusted for CPI.

label: Country code
description: Identifier for a country in two-letter format per ISO 3166-1 alpha-2.

label: GDP (PPP)
description: Gross domestic product (GDP) at purchasing power parity (current international $).

label: Big Mac index
description: "Published by The Economist as an informal way of measuring the purchasing power parity (PPP) between two currencies and provides a test of the extent to which market exchange rates result in goods costing the same in different countries. It "seeks to make exchange-rate theory a bit more digestible."(https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Big_Mac_Index).

label: Ease of doing business
description: "Higher rankings (a low numerical value) indicate better, usually simpler, regulations for businesses and stronger protections of property rights."(https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ease_of_doing_business_index).
